page.title: 17KEMPSTON LEISURE 2
page.content: Many Kempston people, both adults and children, rely heavily on{Bedford}for their major leisure activities, as there is no swimming pool or sports centre in the village. The{River Great {Ouse}offers peaceful riverside{walks, {fishing}and{canoeing}by the weir. Access to the rest of the countryside for most in urban Kempston is restricted by the new by-pass to the south and the river to the north. In the main built-up area there are several{small playing areas}and {recreation grounds.}Many rely on{home- {based activities:-}television, pets, gardening, cooking and home computers. Two{youth clubs}are important for teenagers. Few people go to the{cinema regularly, a combination of distance to Bedford and expense.
